aspect.name: modENCODE
aspect.intro-text: The National Human Genome Research Institute (NHGRI) model organism ENCyclopedia Of DNA Elements (modENCODE) Project will try to identify all of the sequence-based functional elements in the Caenorhabditis elegans and Drosophila melanogaster genomes. The project is run as a Research Network.

aspect.name: Genomics
aspect.subtitle: Genome annotation
aspect.intro-text: The gene structure and other genome annotation in modMine are provided by a variety of source databases. In most cases modMine includes all genome features that have chromosomal locations (e.g. genes and repeat regions).

aspect.name: Comparative Genomics
aspect.subtitle: Orthologues and paralogues
aspect.intro-text: Orthologues and Paralogues. Orthologues are equivalent genes in different species that evolved from a common ancestor by speciation. Paralogues are genes from the same homologous superfamily found in another part of the genome of a particular taxon. Paralogues are the result of gene duplication.

aspect.name: Proteins
aspect.subtitle:
Protein and
proteomics data
aspect.intro-text: Protein annotation, including family and domain annotation, from UniProt and InterPro.

aspect.name: Gene Ontology
aspect.intro-text: Gene Ontology (GO) annotations for Drosophila and C. elegans. The GO annotations are 'attached' to Genes and so each Gene has a reference (link) to a list of its GO annotations (if available).
